abstract: Dell's Maraschino Cherries, Brooklyn-based company found harboring illegal marijuana farm in basement, is set to plead guilty to felony drug possession and illegal dumping of wastewater in city's sewer system; company, whose founder Arthur Mondella committed suicide after discovery, will pay $1.2 million settlement but will continue operating.
lead_paragraph: With the owner of Dell’s Maraschino Cherries dead, investigators have not yet unraveled a marijuana operation’s inner workings or identified the others they believe must be involved.

headline.main: Brooklyn Cherry Business to Plead Guilty Over Pollution and Marijuana
headline.print_headline: Cherry Factory to Plead Guilty Over Pollution and Marijuana

snippet: With the owner of Dell’s Maraschino Cherries dead, investigators have not yet unraveled a marijuana operation’s inner workings or identified the others they believe must be involved.
